column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2017
column14: Amazon does not list the ingredients in the product when you place the order. Caveat Emptor-Let The Buyer Beware.  The problem is that the product contains mineral oil and petroletum oil.  Mineral oil is actually a by-product in the processing of gasoline from petroletum and molecules of the mineral oil are too large to even pass through pores of the skin and will only sit on top of your skin "sealing in" the germs and suffocating your skin from moisture, as well as cutting off precious oxygen and preventing toxins from escaping the skin, that can cause acne. Mineral oil is simply a cheap filler 80% of companies use to help increase their products regardless of the harmful effects to your skin and health. Petroleum is a crude oil found beneath the ground and refined to produce fuels including gasoline, kerosene, and diesel oil. When it is added to beauty products (primarily as a cheap filler), it makes that product comodogenic since it coats the skin and clogs the pores and does not, therefore allow moisture in, resulting in irritation, acne, skin dryness, and dandruff (if inside a hair care product). Do you really think that consumers want to wear toxic makeup that can cause damage?  I read the label when it arrived before I wore it.  That's how I found out these two chemicals were in it.  In the end, it's about safety not a refund!  There are organic lipsticks from very good makeup companies that list their ingredients and that's who I will buy my lipstick from.  It may cost more, but you can't place a price on your health.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020
column14: I bought this lipstick a few years ago (don't remember that....LOL)  & then just again purchased again recently.. I read online that it was a good "dupe" for a lipstick that I love  (Urban Decay BackTalk)  so I decided to give it a try..  First of all the color isn't a color that I would call a dupe or similar to the Urban Decay lipstick, it has more of a tan overall color/look to it which you can see more on my hand..  The BackTalk lipstick is more of a pink overtone which suits me better..  It might be hard to see in the pictures but the hand swatches are very different but of course colors come out different on the lips..  NEXT....  this lipstick lasts for a while, because its a matte one (few hours for me because I don't do much eating or drinking alot)  & I always find myself reapplying lipstick through the day anyway..  NEXT...  I didn't find this lipstick very moisturizing... My lips are usually very dry & I have to use a lip balm/lip conditioner  before I put on my lipstick & that helps the lipstick be a bit more moisturizing especially if its a matte one..  I like the matte lipsticks because they stay on a bit longer, don't usually find them very moisturizing..  If you're looking for moisturizing lipsticks them go for creamier lipsticks, those are usually good..

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2018
column14: My daughter and I are dressing as peacocks for Halloween 2018 and I thought I'd give the Ruby Kisses Ultra Matte Super Rich Lipstick a try. It arrived in time for us to attend an early Halloween party. Any misgivings I had about it were quickly discarded. This particular lipstick went on easily, the color is very vibrant, and it wears very well; we didn't have to refresh lipstick until after we'd been eating and drinking for quite a bit. Even then, the lipstick was still noticeable, though slightly worn. (My daughter is very conscious of makeup, though, and wanted a refresher.) After reapplying around 6:30, we had to use a wet paper towel to get it off her lips at 9 p.m.

column6: Definitely worth the color and price
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2018
column14: Finding bold, fun lip colors at a reasonable price is pretty difficult.  I was a bit skeptical about this lipstick because of the price ($3.70), but decided to purchase it based on others' review photos.  I'm glad I did!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021
column14: I have to say, even though I have a full array of lip products, these Kiss lipsticks are daily heroes.  They are more than affordable, long-lasting, I like the texture as I can apply it over a fading liquid lip and it keeps me going.  Don't sleep on these lipsticks.

column14: I ordered the blue lipstick (whatever the color is called) and i absolutely LOVE IT!!!, it rubs off too easily though.

column14: Very pretty color! I love it!
